> How many times have y'all banned ppl in the last week?

Banning people is very, very rare. A good moderator does not enjoy banning people. Instead, he or she works very hard to *avoid* banning someone. A ban is always a last resort after every effort has been made to help a person understand the community's way of doing things. 

Banning spam bots and SEO spammers, on the other hand, is a daily occurance.

It helps that the approval queue does a pretty good job of weeding them out, so we have a chance to spot them and remove them before they're publicly visible to regular forum members.

It also *<u>really</u>* helps that we have a thousand eyes helping us.  On those occasions when a spammer slips past us, typically some forum member will notice something and ~~activate the Bat-Signal~~ file a report, which draws our attention and then we can clean it up posthaste.  So we can't entirely claim all the credit for ourselves, much though we might like to.  ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

Ive wondered from time to time about an aspect of the name change system some folks take advantage of. You have user XYZ and they ask for their name to now by ZYX. Ok cool, an available moderator catches sight of the request and does what ever switch flips yall do and they have their shiny new name. How does the user in question learn they have been granted said new name? By chance or does the forum send a message to them similar to the notice you get when you get a pm? I know its an odd question from me since I doubt I will ever avail myself of the name change system, but i figured Id ask and perhaps a user considering it will learn a bit more of the process ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")
